title: The new rewards suck.
body:
Before patch 7.22 I used to be able to rake up 1100 plus ip in around 10 games maybe even more than that counting the first victory boost,
now in order to get any sort of reward for my time (and tilt) i have to play 10 plus games and IF im lucky it willl be enough to level up and get a ramdom stupid capsule. The past 2 levels ive gotten 2 caps with 745 BE.....for the amount of games i played thats literaly nothing, i started playing from 10 pm and just stoped now at 9:47 am, played about 25-30  games for bs, oh and did i mention that to get any exp worth your time you have to win the match? cuase you do. Lose and you get barely half. Id have enough IP by now to buy the champs i want if it wasent for this garbage and over all the tilt dosent match the reward and feels more like a shore to level up rather than actual fun.

Anyway thats my opinion on it, your entitled to your own or it might just be my luck but on top of all the toxic bs , the tilt and now being forced to level up to get shitty rewards? f that. if enything id say this is so people get inpatient end buy rp. F that.

Where did they mention that grades affect xp gains?
Far as I'm aware, only time and victory do.

Now lets look at your math.

Amusing you got 580 blue essence for 2 levels, that would net an effective value of 1160.
By comparison, you claim you should have gotten 1680.
Shards are worth 20% the purchase price of a champion, upgrading costs 60% the purchase price.

So assuming you upgraded 1 450 champion (90 BE value, 270 cost, 180 savings), that would bring your effective total to 1340. *Worst case scenario.*

Lets assume instead you upgrade a 1350 champion (270 value, 810 cost, 540 savings). That brings your new effective value to 1700. *20 more than your expectation.*

Lets now assume your second chest is a 6300 champion (1260 value, 3780 cost, 2520 savings). While you wouldn't be able to afford it yet, upgrading that shard would bring your effective value to 3100. *1420 more than your expectation.*

Now, there are 13 450 champions out of 139 total. That means each chest has about a 9% chance of pulling a negative value in this scenario.

------------------------------------

If your intention is to upgrade as many shards as possible (You can't upgrade them all), this system will give you significantly more *effective* ~~IP~~ BE.

If you want a *specific* champion, however, you're stuck either waiting for the 0.7% chance of getting it in a chest, or disenchanting everything else you get (negating all savings).

I don't think you understand so let me clarify. I didn't get a champ AND 580 blue essence, I got JUST the blue essence. That's the first thing the second thing is if you are lucky enough to get a champ you still don't have access to set champ, because you still have to activate the perm version of them, they aren't activated, they are just the SHARD of the champion, meaning you still need the essence to actually activate them afterward. Maybe now you understand how much of a ripoff it is. And on top of all that since champ shards are random 90% of the time the only thing you'll end up doing with them is breaking them into essences.

The bottom line is right now you get less essence and a CHANCE at a champion shard that you might want to use, which if you want specific champs is just near impossible. In either case you're still putting in way more time and getting way less out of it than you used to.

>I don't think you understand so let me clarify. I didn't get a champ AND 580 blue essence, I got JUST the blue essence. 

Ok, I did misunderstand. I thought all the level up chests were supposed to have champ shards. So I assumed 580 was the value of your chest. (shard value + BE = 580).

>because you still have to activate the perm version of them 

That's why I increased the scenario to 2 levels with only 1 upgraded (on the assumption that every chest had at least 1 shard). That way the lowest tiers were unlockable for a more static base line.
And even if you don't unlock the champion immediately, any champion upgraded effectively increases the value of the chest it came from. So a 6300 champ shard is worth 2520 BE *if* you intend to upgrade it; regardless of when you actually do.

I'd still estimate that the average effective value in this system, assuming you upgrade as many shards as possible, is greater.
Though I concede that the potential for shardless chests could noticeably degrade the degree of improvement, since I was working with an only 9% chance for negative values.

Actually, I'd like to put a call-out. How many people so far *have* received shardless chests?
